text: do you make pizzas at home if you do I'm
sure you'll agree that the hardest part
is getting the pizza with all of your
beautiful toppings to your pizza stone
in one piece I'm gonna show you a little
trick that I've developed here that is
completely effortless and it keeps your
pizza stone from turning black and
discolored like this I'm gonna start
with a little bit of pizza dough here
doorbot is fine you want to make sure
that you get your perfectly round crust
and at this point I'm gonna transfer it
to a piece of parchment paper and I'm
just using a rimless baking sheet here
so I'm just gonna fold this over place
it right on top come right on to my work
surface and just finish forming it leave
a little bit of an edge for the crust
now whatever toppings you like I'm gonna
make something that's really simple a
basic tomato sauce don't add too much
sauce you don't want a soggy pizza leave
about an inch to create a border some
nice fresh mozzarella cheese don't add
too much because this has a lot of
moisture if you add too much cheese
you're gonna end up with a watery pizza
so a little goes a long way
and then season your pizza because that
dough needs flavor so a little bit of
salt freshly ground pepper how simple
maybe a little drizzle of olive oil I've
preheated my oven to 450 degrees with a
pizza stone set in the center rack and
this is gonna go in for about 10 minutes
the parchment paper it makes it so easy
slides right into the oven no need for
flour no need for semolina the pizza
looks great slide it right onto my tray
the pizza stone is clean
now I'm just gonna finish this up with a
little bit of garnish some basil leaves
to top it off this is just a simple
margherita pizza I'm gonna finish it
with a little bit of olive oil so there
you have it using parchment paper with
your favorite pizza recipe will make
pizza night even better
